extension.description:
Zen Tools makes creating image and content galleries for Joomla simple.


The module features the following layouts:

  • Grid galleries
  • Responsive Slideshows
  • Responsive Carousels
  • Masonry Layouts
  • Accordions
  • Simple Lists and more

You can use this module to display your Joomla content, your k2 items or even images from a folder.

Please ensure you read the documentation contained within the module or via the Zentools demo site.

Version: 1.10.5

field.label: Layout Type
field.description: Select between content items or a folder containing images.

field.description: Select between content items or a folder containing images.

field.description: The number of items to display (default 5)

field.name: link
field.label: Link Behaviour
field.description: Choose the action that occurs when an image is clicked. See the demo site for instrtuctions related to the content item and blog category options.

field.name: linktarget
field.label: Link Target
field.description: Choose where the link should open to in the browser window.

field.name: altlink
field.label: Alternate Link
field.description: Joomla 2.5 provides the option of specifying additional links to your content item. This option when enabled uses the Link A in the content item as the link for the Read more and title link attached to the content item. If the Link A field is not set then the module will display links in the standard manner.

field.name: extlinks
field.label: Links
field.description: Enter a url per line in the text area to attach an external link to your items. Please note that this feature does not work with randomly generated content. The urls at th emoment are assigned to the items as they appear in the module eg the first url in the list below relates to the first item shown in the module and so on. If there are more items being displayed in the module than there are links below then the links will return as null.

field.name: col2Width

field.name: col4Width

field.name: directory

field.description: Directory images will be sourced from - this is the relative directory eg images/stories/.

field.name: prefix
field.label: Order images based on prefix?
field.description: When enabled the image title are broken into the following elements: image number - title - text - articleid - itemid. When disabled the image title is broken into the following elements: title - text - articleid - itemid. We do this so that you can force the ordering of the images in the folder by adding a suitable alphanumeric prefix to the image title.

field.name: separator

field.description: Enter the character you want to use in your file names in order to render a space in the output of the module. As an example a file named A+Happy+Picture.jpg will output in the module as A Happy Picture if the separator is nominated is the + symbol. If you have trouble with the file manager renaming or removing the separator you choose please try using another character to render spaces in the module output.

field.name: allowed_tags

field.description: This setting defines the tags you want to display in the slideshow. We've created this option primarily to remove images from the output but you can allow or disallow any html entity you like.

field.name: renderPlugin
field.label: Plugin Behaviour in Content?
field.description: Choose how you would like to handle plugin code {} in the content.

field.name: readonText

field.description: The text used to display when read more is enabled.

field.name: overlayMore
field.label: Overlay the more button?
field.description: When enabled this option positions the read more button on top of the other content in the module. For best effect please ensure that the image item is published above the more tag in the list of tags to be displayed in the module.

field.name: animateMoreOverlay
field.label: Animate more overlay?
field.description: When enabled the more button will only appear when the user hovers over the item. If this option is disabled it will apear all of the time.

field.name: translateDate
field.label: Use language file?
field.description: If this option is set to yes the options below are not used. Rather the date is displayed according to your language file.

field.name: dateString
field.label: Translation to use?
field.description: If this option is set to yes the options below are not used. Rather the date is displayed according to your language file.

field.name: dateFormat
field.label: Date Format if not using translation method
field.description: Date format to use if you have set the translate option above to no

field.name: disableMargin
field.label: Disable margin between grid items?
field.description: When enabled the default right margin attribute is disabled and the items within the grid will sit directly next to each other.

field.name: overlayGrid
field.label: Add an overlay effect?
field.description: When enabled this option implements an overlay effect where the first item sits beneath the other items displayed in the module. This effect is best used when the image is the first item in the list below and when the layout selected is either grid or carousel.

field.name: animateOverlay
field.label: Animate overlay effect?
field.description: When enabled any items that are contained within the overlay will appear when the user hovers over the image.

field.name: categoryFilter
field.label: Category Filter
field.description: This option provides a list of the categories that the items in the module are referenced from. When the user clicks on the category title the module either hides or shows the items that are published in that specific category. Please note that this option will only work with the grid and list layout types.

field.name: filterstart_joomla
field.label: Active category
field.description: Select the category that you want to set as active on page load. Leave this field blank to show all items on page load.

field.name: filterstart_k2
field.label: Active category
field.description: Select the category that you want to set as active on page load. Leave this field blank to show all items on page load.

field.name: filterwidth

field.description: Enter the width that you want to trigger a change from the filter titles from text to icons.

field.name: pagStartPage

field.description: The page that is first displayed on page load.

field.name: pagStartRange

field.name: pagMidRange

field.name: pagEndRange

field.description: Set the width of the resized image.

field.description: Set this to yes if you would like to the image to have a title attribute.

field.title: Target images based on screen size

field.default: Please view the responsive image option knowledgebase item for more information about the settings below.

field.name: responsiveimages
field.label: Resize images based on screensize
field.description:
The settings below determine the size of the images that will be used in the module at the various breakpoints listed below.

If the Resize Image option is enabled above then the default image setting refers to the width and height determined in the settings above.

However if the resize option is disabled then the default value is equal to the width and height of the original image.

field.name: sourceImage
field.label: Source Image
field.description: Select the size of image to use as the source image which is loaded on first page load. If there is a javascript issue and the other specified images are unable to load then this will be the default image used for the item.

field.name: mobile
field.label: Phone
field.description: Select the size of image to be used on phones in portrait view.

field.name: tabletPortrait
field.label: Tablet Portrait
field.description: Select the size of image to be used for tablets in portrait view.

field.name: tabletLandscape
field.label: Tablet Landscape
field.description: Select the size of image to be used for tablets in landscape view.

field.name: desktopImage
field.label: Desktop
field.description: Select the size of image to be used for desktop screens.

field.name: wideImage
field.label: Widescreen (1281px +)
field.description: Select the size of image to be used for widescreens.

field.name: fullwidthimage
field.label: Make images fill 100% of the container.
field.description: When this setting is enabled images will stretch to fit the full width of the parent container. This setting is useful if you are using the responsive image option above but some images are smaller than the breakpoitns specified.

field.name: itemImgSize
field.label: K2 Image Size
field.description: This option determines the source file to be used if your item has an image in the K2 item field. Zentools looks for an image in the k2 item field first and if it exists then it uses that image in the item. If the item does not have an image in the K2 Item field then it will look for an image in the introtext if that image exists. If that image does not exist then it will display a placeholder image according to your settings below. If you want to always use the introtext image then you can set this option introtext image and it will bypass looking for an image in the item field.

field.name: usePlaceholder
field.label: Use placeholder image?
field.description: When this settings is enabled a placeholder image is used in the module when an item image is not available. Setting this to no will mean that no image is output in the item if an image is not available.

field.name: imageEffect
field.label: Image Border?
field.description: Use this setting to determine the effect to apply to the image in the layout. The rounded and shadow items relate to css3 styles and will not render on browsers that do not support css3. The image can be further styled in your stylesheet by applying the following stylings for their respective styles .zenshadow img, .zenrounded img, .zenborder img.

field.name: imageFade
field.label: Image fade on hover?
field.description: When this settings is enabled and the user hovers over the image displayed in the item the image will fade from a full opacity to 0.3 opacity.

field.name: imageFX
field.label: Add image effect?
field.description: When this settings is enabled a zoom effect is added to the image when the user hovers over.

field.name: imageGrayscaleFx
field.label: Add grayscale image effect?
field.description: When this settings is enabled a color effect is added to the image when the user hovers over.

field.name: accordionOpen
field.label: Open first accordion item?
field.description: Setting this option to open first panel only will open only the first accordion panel when the page loads.

field.name: masonryWidths
field.label: Masonry Widths
field.description: This option determines the width of the items in the masonry grid. If this option is set to equalise the width of the items, then the items will be displayed with even widths across the width of the parent container eg. if the width is set to three columns then the items in the module will always display in 3 columns regardless of the width of the page. Otherwise if this option is set to retrieve widths specified in the article's meta keywords then each item can have an individual width that is controlled by the first word in the metakeyword for that article. For example if the word four is the first word of the meta keyword for an item then the item will span a four out of twelve columns or a third of the width of the page. If the first word is six then the item will span half or six out of twelve columns across the page.
field.option: Use widths specified in meta keywords

field.name: masonryColWidths
field.label: Widths (Columns)
field.description: The method you would like to use when resizing images.

field.name: browserThreshold
field.label: Browser Threshold
field.description: Set the browser width that should trigger the change to single column mode. This option will only work if you are using a responsive width layout or a % based layout.

field.name: masonryColumnWidth
field.label: Base Masonry Column Width
field.description: Width in pixels of 1 column of your grid.

field.name: masonryGutter
field.label: Masonry Gutter
field.description: Adds additional spacing between columns.

field.name: minItems
field.label: Minimum Items
field.description: Set the minumum number of items to display in the carousel. As you reduce the width of the browser and the carousel container this number of items will remain visible in the carousel.

field.name: carouselSpeed
field.label: Carousel Speed
field.description: The speed for the carousel to move to the next group of items.

field.name: imageW
field.label: Carousel item width
field.description: The width of each item in the carousel.

field.name: overlayCarousel
field.label: Add an overlay effect?
field.description: When enabled this option implements an overlay effect where the first item sits beneath the other items displayed in the module. This effect is best used when the image is the first item in the list below and when the layout selected is either grid or carousel.

field.name: animateOverlayCarousel
field.label: Animate overlay effect?
field.description: When enabled any items that are contained within the overlay will appear when the user hovers over the image.

field.name: slideshowTheme
field.label: Slideshow Theme
field.description: This setting applies specific css to your slideshow to recreate specific layouts. The overlay theme is focussed on using the image as a background and overlaying the text and other elements on top of the image. The flat layout displays the items in a flat list like layout in the module..

field.name: overlayAnimation
field.label: Animate details in Overlay theme?
field.description: When enabled the slideshow items that sit on top of the slideshow image when using the Overlay theme slide up and slide down as the main image transitions from one image to the next.

field.name: slideshowAuto
field.label: Enable slideshow autoplay
field.description: When enabled the slideshow will automatically cycle through the slides available in the slideshow.

field.name: slideshowLoop
field.label: Continuous Loop
field.description: If this settign is enabled the slideshow will cycle continuously through the available slides. If the setting is disabled then the slideshow will stop at the last slide.

field.name: transition
field.label: Slideshow transition
field.description: Determines the transition behaviour when the slideshow moves from one slide to the next.

field.name: slideshowSpeed
field.label: Slide Duration
field.description: The speed for the slideshow transition

field.name: slideshowDuration
field.label: Transition Speed
field.description: The tiem that each slide stays on the screen

field.name: slideshowPaginationType
field.label: Pagination type
field.description: Select the type of pagination used for the slideshow.

field.name: slideshowPaginationPos
field.label: Slideshow pagination position.
field.description: The setting below determines the position of the pagination elements in the slideshow.

field.name: slideshowTitleTheme
field.label: Slideshow title theme
field.description: The theme you would liek to apply to the slideshow when using titles as pagination.

field.name: slideTitleWidth
field.label: Width of title pagination
field.description: This setting defines the width of the triggers for each slide when the title method of pagination is used. Please refer to the Zen Tools documentation for a more through understanding of how to implement this feature.

field.name: slideTitleHide
field.label: Hide title breakpoint
field.description: This setting determines when the titles in the slideshow should be hidden. When the browser is below the px width specified here the pagination will revert to the disc style.

field.name: itemsperpage
field.label: Items per pagination page
field.description: This setting allows the user to specify the number of pagination items to show.

field.name: thumb_width
field.label: Thumb Width
field.description: The width of the thumbnail image - without px

field.name: thumb_height
field.label: Thumb Height
field.description: The height of the thumbnail image - without px

field.name: slideCount
field.label: Slideshow count
field.description: When enabled a count of the number of items in the slideshow are displayed on the page.

field.name: slideCountSep
field.label: Slide count separator
field.description: This option allows you to place a string in between the current slide and the total number of slides on the page if the setting above is enabled.

field.name: slideshowNav
field.label: Enable navigation
field.description: When enabled next and previous arrows will be rendered inside the module.

field.name: slideshowPause
field.label: Display pause / play button
field.description: When enabled a button will appear that is able to pause or play the slideshow.

field.name: playText
field.label: Play Text
field.description: The text used to display the play command

field.name: pauseText
field.label: Pause Text
field.description: The text used to display the pause command

field.default: The settings below are only relevant if the content source selected above is either Joomla or K2. If you have selected directory as a source then the image will be shown in the lightbox and the width and other options will not apply.

field.name: modalTitle
field.label: Display Title
field.description: When enabled, the title of the item will appear in the lightbox.

field.name: modalImage
field.label: Display Image
field.description: When enabled, the first image found int he introtext of the item will appear in the lightbox. Disable this option if you are also displaying the introtext.

field.name: modalText
field.label: Display Intro Text
field.description: When enabled, the introtext of the item will appear in the lightbox.

field.name: modalVideo
field.label: K2 Video
field.description: When enabled, and if the K2 Media field is populated a video will display in the modal window.

field.name: modalMore
field.label: Display read more
field.description: When enabled this option will diosplay a link to the full text of the item in question. This option only works when using the content item link as the destination for the item links.

field.name: modalThumbTip
field.label: Display thumbnails tips
field.description: When enabled this option will display a tip with the title for thumbnails.

field.name: modalFooterTitle
field.label: Display Title on Footer
field.description: When enabled, the title of the item will appear in the lightbox footer.

field.name: modalWidth
field.label: Modal window width
field.description: This option sets the width of the modal window if the slideshow type is set to either content or K2

field.name: twitterName
field.label: Twitter Username (via)
field.description: The Twitter username to show: via @username at the end of tweet.

field.name: tweetText
field.label: Default Text
field.description: The tweet default text.

field.name: tweetCount
field.label: Show Counter?
field.description: Shows the tweets count.

field.name: tweetHashtag
field.label: Hashtag #
field.description: The hashtag you want to insert.

field.name: tweetLargeButton
field.label: Large Button
field.description: Choose to use the large button.

field.name: scripts
field.label: CSS and Javascript
field.description: This option can be used to remove all javascript and css from being loaded by the zentools module. If in doubt leave this option enabled. If you are using the Zen Grid framework version2 then the scripts and css files will be loaded via the framework. If your site uses caching then the relevant files will be loaded into the body of your site.

field.name: cache
field.label: Caching
field.description: Select whether to cache the content of this module

field.name: cache_time
field.label: Cache Time
field.description: The time before the module is recached
